Description added:

RPPA is the method for measuring peptide target expression. These expressions are quantified by comparing them with healthy persons.

## Load Library

```{r}
#| label: "load-libraries" 
#| echo: TRUE
#| eval: TRUE 
#| output: FALSE  

library("tidyverse")
library("table1")
library("here")
```

## Loading the data

```{r}
#| label: "load-data" 

expression_meta_data_load<- read_tsv(file = here("data/03_expression_meta_data_load.tsv.gz"))

expression_meta_data_clean <- read_tsv(file = here("data/04_expression_meta_data_clean.tsv.gz"))

expression_meta_data_aug <- read_tsv(file = here("data/04_expression_meta_data_aug.tsv.gz"))
```

## Discription

-   how many patients

```{r}
expression_meta_data_aug |>
  select(patient_id) |>
  n_distinct()
```

-   could compare with the original data before cleaning

```{r}
expression_meta_data_load |>
  select(submitter_id) |>
  n_distinct()

```

-   Check what different pathologic stages there are:

```{r}
# Count occurrences of pathologic_stages per patient_id
expression_meta_data_aug |> 
  group_by(pathologic_stage) |> 
  summarize(count = n(), .groups = "drop")  # Count the occurrences and ungroup
```

-   Check the lowest and highest age

```{r}
expression_meta_data_aug |> 
  summarize(
    min_age = min(age_at_index, na.rm = TRUE), # Lowest age
    max_age = max(age_at_index, na.rm = TRUE)  # Highest age
  )
```

-   Check how many peptides

```{r}
n_peptides <- expression_meta_data_aug |>
  select(peptide_target) |>
  n_distinct()

n_peptides
```
